property.name: mediacaption
property.value: U.S. Marine Corps photo by Sgt. Alicia R. Leaders

note.text: The Marine Corps teaches a broad range of culture-general concepts and skills. Using this knowledge, Marines are able to choose a framework appropriate to each mission. This approach integrates culture into the planning process.
The Marine Corps commonly uses the Five Dimensions of Culture framework. These dimensions are:

- human interaction with the physical environment
- economic structure, or exchange systems
- political structure
- social structure
- belief systems
